verses.verse: After <WH310> this<WH3651> opened<WH6605> Job<WH347> <WH853> his mouth,<WH6310> and cursed<WH7043> <WH853> his day.<WH3117>
And Job<WH347> spoke,<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
Let the day<WH3117> perish<WH6> wherein I was born,<WH3205> and the night<WH3915> in which it was said,<WH559> There is a man child<WH1397> conceived.<WH2029>
Let that<WH1931> day<WH3117> be<WH1961> darkness;<WH2822> let not<WH408> God<WH433> regard<WH1875> it from above,<WH4480> <WH4605> neither<WH408> let the light<WH5105> shine<WH3313> upon<WH5921> it.
Let darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death<WH6757> stain<WH1350> it; let a cloud<WH6053> dwell<WH7931> upon<WH5921> it; let the blackness<WH3650> of the day<WH3117> terrify<WH1204> it.

As for that<WH1931> night,<WH3915> let darkness<WH652> seize upon<WH3947> it; let it not<WH408> be joined<WH2302> unto the days<WH3117> of the year,<WH8141> let it not<WH408> come<WH935> into the number<WH4557> of the months.<WH3391>
Lo, <WH2009> let that<WH1931> night<WH3915> be<WH1961> solitary,<WH1565> let no<WH408> joyful voice<WH7445> come<WH935> therein.
Let them curse<WH5344> it that curse<WH779> the day,<WH3117> who are ready<WH6264> to raise up<WH5782> their mourning.<WH3882>

Let the stars<WH3556> of the twilight<WH5399> thereof be dark;<WH2821> let it look<WH6960> for light,<WH216> but have none;<WH369> neither<WH408> let it see<WH7200> the dawning<WH6079> of the day: <WH7837>
Because <WH3588> it shut not up<WH3808> <WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of my mother's womb,<WH990> nor hid<WH5641> sorrow<WH5999> from mine eyes.<WH4480> <WH5869>
Why <WH4100> died<WH4191> I not<WH3808> from the womb?<WH4480> <WH7358> why did I not give up the ghost<WH1478> when I came out<WH3318> of the belly?<WH4480> <WH990>
Why <WH4069> did the knees<WH1290> prevent<WH6923> me? or why<WH4100> the breasts<WH7699> that<WH3588> I should suck?<WH3243>
For <WH3588> now<WH6258> should I have lain still<WH7901> and been quiet,<WH8252> I should have slept:<WH3462> then<WH227> had I been at rest,<WH5117>
With <WH5973> kings<WH4428> and counselors<WH3289> of the earth,<WH776> which built<WH1129> desolate places<WH2723> for themselves;
Or <WH176> with<WH5973> princes<WH8269> that had gold,<WH2091> who filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with silver: <WH3701>
Or <WH176> as a hidden<WH2934> untimely birth<WH5309> I had not<WH3808> been;<WH1961> as infants<WH5768> which never<WH3808> saw<WH7200> light.<WH216>
There <WH8033> the wicked<WH7563> cease<WH2308> from troubling;<WH7267> and there<WH8033> the weary<WH3019> <WH3581> be at rest.<WH5117>
There the prisoners<WH615> rest<WH7599> together;<WH3162> they hear<WH8085> not<WH3808> the voice<WH6963> of the oppressor.<WH5065>
The small<WH6996> and great<WH1419> are there;<WH8033> and the servant<WH5650> is free<WH2670> from his master.<WH4480> <WH113>
Wherefore <WH4100> is light<WH216> given<WH5414> to him that is in misery,<WH6001> and life<WH2416> unto the bitter<WH4751> in soul;<WH5315>
Which long<WH2442> for death,<WH4194> but it cometh not;<WH369> and dig<WH2658> for it more than for hid treasures;<WH4480> <WH4301>
Which rejoice<WH8056> exceedingly,<WH413> <WH1524> and are glad,<WH7797> when<WH3588> they can find<WH4672> the grave?<WH6913>
Why is light given to a man<WH1397> whose<WH834> way<WH1870> is hid,<WH5641> and whom<WH1157> God<WH433> hath hedged in?<WH5526>
For <WH3588> my sighing<WH585> cometh<WH935> before<WH6440> I eat,<WH3899> and my roarings<WH7581> are poured out<WH5413> like the waters.<WH4325>
For <WH3588> the thing which I greatly feared<WH6343> <WH6342> is come upon<WH857> me, and that which<WH834> I was afraid of<WH3025> is come<WH935> unto me.
I was not<WH3808> in safety,<WH7951> neither<WH3808> had I rest,<WH8252> neither<WH3808> was I quiet;<WH5117> yet trouble<WH7267> came.<WH935>
